titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Ansel and Idelle Van Buren bond 1977.557
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:14:22 +0000.

did.unittitle: Ansel and Idelle Van Buren bond
did.abstract: Bond of Ansel and Idelle Van Buren of $21,000 to Henry Lankenau. Signed by a Kings County notary public and dated 1891. Ansel Hayes Van Buren (1846-1910) married Idelle Newell on November 11, 1884. Ansel was an acomplished musician and salesman with various piano houses in Brooklyn. He and Idelle lived in the Brooklyn neighborhood of Flatbush.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Ansel Hayes Van Buren (1846-1910) married Idelle Newell on November 11, 1884. Ansel was an acomplished musician and salesman with various piano houses in Brooklyn. He and Idelle lived in the Brooklyn neighborhood of Flatbush.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Bond of Ansel and Idelle Van Buren of $21,000 to Henry Lankenau. Signed by a Kings County notary public and dated 1891.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Ansel and Idelle Van Buren bond, 1977.557, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
